ist_nodes.name: Root
ist_nodes.description: Root record of JSON input for Flow123d.

keys.description: Simulation problem to be solved.
If true, the program will wait for key press before it terminates.

ist_nodes.name: Problem
ist_nodes.description: The root record of description of particular the problem to solve.

ist_nodes.name: SequentialCoupling
ist_nodes.description: Record with data for a general sequential coupling.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

Short description of the solved problem.
Is displayed in the main log, and possibly in other text output files.
Computational mesh common to all equations.
Simulation time frame and time step.
Primary equation, have all data given.
The equation that depends (the velocity field) on the result of the primary equation.

ist_nodes.name: Mesh
ist_nodes.description: Record with mesh related data.

keys.description: Input file with mesh description.
List of additional region definitions not contained in the mesh.

List of region set definitions. There are three region sets implicitly defined:
ALL (all regions of the mesh), BOUNDARY (all boundary regions), and BULK (all bulk regions)
Parameters of mesh partitioning algorithms.

ist_nodes.name: Region
ist_nodes.description: Definition of region of elements.

keys.description: Label (name) of the region. Has to be unique in one mesh.
The ID of the region to which you assign label.
Specification of the region by the list of elements. This is not recomended

ist_nodes.name: RegionSet
ist_nodes.description: Definition of one region set.

keys.description: Unique name of the region set.
List of region ID numbers that has to be added to the region set.
List of labels of the regions that has to be added to the region set.
Defines region set as a union of given pair of sets. Overrides previous keys.
Defines region set as an intersection of given pair of sets. Overrides previous keys.
Defines region set as a difference of given pair of sets. Overrides previous keys.

ist_nodes.name: Partition
ist_nodes.description: Setting for various types of mesh partitioning.

keys.description: Software package used for partitioning. See corresponding selection.
Algorithm for generating graph and its weights from a multidimensional mesh.

ist_nodes.name: PartTool
ist_nodes.description: Select the partitioning tool to use.

values.name: PETSc
values.description: Use PETSc interface to various partitioning tools.

values.name: METIS
values.description: Use direct interface to Metis.

ist_nodes.name: GraphType
ist_nodes.description:
Different algorithms to make the sparse graph with weighted edges
from the multidimensional mesh. Main difference is dealing with 
neighborings of elements of different dimension.

values.name: any_neighboring
values.description: Add edge for any pair of neighboring elements.

values.name: any_wight_lower_dim_cuts
values.description: Same as before and assign higher weight to cuts of lower dimension in order to make them stick to one face.

values.name: same_dimension_neghboring
values.description: Add edge for any pair of neighboring elements of same dimension (bad for matrix multiply).

ist_nodes.name: TimeGovernor
ist_nodes.description: Setting of the simulation time. (can be specific to one equation)

keys.description: Start time of the simulation.
End time of the simulation.

Initial guess for the time step.
Only useful for equations that use adaptive time stepping.If set to 0.0, the time step is determined in fully autonomous way if the equation supports it.
Soft lower limit for the time step. Equation using adaptive time stepping can notsuggest smaller time step, but actual time step could be smaller in order to match prescribed input or output times.
Hard upper limit for the time step. Actual length of the time step is also limitedby input and output times.

default.value: Whole time of the simulation if specified, infinity else.

ist_nodes.name: DarcyFlowMH
ist_nodes.description: Mixed-Hybrid  solver for saturated Darcy flow.

ist_nodes.name: Steady_MH
ist_nodes.description: Mixed-Hybrid  solver for STEADY saturated Darcy flow.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Number of Schur complements to perform when solving MH sytem.
Linear solver for MH problem.
Parameters of output form MH module.
Method for coupling Darcy flow between dimensions.
Settings for computing mass balance.

ist_nodes.name: LinSys
ist_nodes.description: Linear solver setting.

ist_nodes.name: Petsc
ist_nodes.description: Solver setting.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Relative residual tolerance (to initial error).
Maximum number of outer iterations of the linear solver.
Absolute residual tolerance.
Options passed to PETSC before creating KSP instead of default setting.

ist_nodes.name: Bddc
ist_nodes.description: Solver setting.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Relative residual tolerance (to initial error).
Maximum number of outer iterations of the linear solver.
Maximum number of iterations of the linear solver with non-decreasing residual.
Number of levels in the multilevel method (=2 for the standard BDDC).
Use adaptive selection of constraints in BDDCML.
Level of verbosity of the BDDCML library: 0 - no output, 1 - mild output, 2 - detailed output.

ist_nodes.name: DarcyMHOutput
ist_nodes.description: Parameters of MH output.

keys.description: Parameters of output stream.
List of fields to write to output file.
SPECIAL PURPOSE. Computing errors pro non-compatible coupling.
Output file with raw data form MH module.

ist_nodes.name: OutputStream
ist_nodes.description: Parameters of output.

keys.description: File path to the connected output file.
Format of output stream and possible parameters.

Time interval between outputs.
Regular grid of output time points starts at the initial time of the equation and ends at the end time which must be specified.
The start time and the end time are always added.
Explicit array of output time points (can be combined with 'time_step'.

default.value:
List containing the initial time of the equation. 
 You can prescribe an empty list to override this behavior.

keys.description: Add all input time points of the equation, mentioned in the 'input_fields' list, also as the output points.

ist_nodes.name: OutputTime
ist_nodes.description: Format of output stream and possible parameters.

ist_nodes.name: vtk
ist_nodes.description: Parameters of vtk output format.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Variant of output stream file format.
Parallel or serial version of file format.
Compression used in output stream file format.

values.name: ascii
values.description: ASCII variant of VTK file format

values.name: binary
values.description: Binary variant of VTK file format (not supported yet)

ist_nodes.name: Type of compression of VTK file format
ist_nodes.full_name: Type of compression of VTK file format

values.name: none
values.description: Data in VTK file format are not compressed

values.name: zlib
values.description: Data in VTK file format are compressed using zlib (not supported yet)

ist_nodes.name: gmsh
ist_nodes.description: Parameters of gmsh output format.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

ist_nodes.name: DarcyMHOutput_Selection
ist_nodes.description: Selection of fields available for output.

values.name: anisotropy
values.description: Output of the field anisotropy $[-]$ (Anisotropy of the conductivity tensor.).

values.name: cross_section
values.description: Output of the field cross_section $[m^{3-d}]$ (Complement dimension parameter (cross section for 1D, thickness for 2D).).

values.name: conductivity
values.description: Output of the field conductivity $[ms^{-1}]$ (Isotropic conductivity scalar.).

values.name: sigma
values.description: Output of the field sigma $[-]$ (Transition coefficient between dimensions.).

values.name: water_source_density
values.description: Output of the field water_source_density $[s^{-1}]$ (Water source density.).

values.name: init_pressure
values.description: Output of the field init_pressure $[m]$ (Initial condition as pressure).

values.name: storativity
values.description: Output of the field storativity $[m^{-1}]$ (Storativity.).

values.name: pressure_p0
values.description: Output of the field pressure_p0 $[m]$.

values.name: pressure_p1
values.description: Output of the field pressure_p1 $[m]$.

values.name: piezo_head_p0
values.description: Output of the field piezo_head_p0 $[m]$.

values.name: velocity_p0
values.description: Output of the field velocity_p0 $[ms^{-1}]$.

values.name: subdomain
values.description: Output of the field subdomain $[-]$.

values.name: region_id
values.description: Output of the field region_id $[-]$.

values.name: pressure_diff
values.description: Output of the field pressure_diff $[m]$.

values.name: velocity_diff
values.description: Output of the field velocity_diff $[ms^{-1}]$.

values.name: div_diff
values.description: Output of the field div_diff $[s^{-1}]$.

values.name: None
values.description: Mortar space: P0 on elements of lower dimension.

values.name: P0
values.description: Mortar space: P0 on elements of lower dimension.

values.name: P1
values.description: Mortar space: P1 on intersections, using non-conforming pressures.

ist_nodes.name: Balance
ist_nodes.description: Balance of a conservative quantity, boundary fluxes and sources.

keys.description: Balance is computed if the value is true.
Format of output file.
Compute cumulative balance over time. If true, then balance is calculated at each computational time step, which can slow down the program.
File name for output of balance.

ist_nodes.name: Balance_output_format
ist_nodes.description: Format of output file for balance.

values.name: legacy
values.description: Legacy format used by previous program versions.

values.name: txt
values.description: Excel format with tab delimiter.

values.name: gnuplot
values.description: Format compatible with GnuPlot datafile with fixed column width.

ist_nodes.name: DarcyFlowMH_Data
ist_nodes.description:
Record to set fields of the equation.
The fields are set only on the domain specified by one of the keys: 'region', 'rid', 'r_set'
and after the time given by the key 'time'. The field setting can be overridden by
 any DarcyFlowMH_Data record that comes later in the boundary data array.

keys.description: Name of region set where to set fields.
Label of the region where to set fields.
ID of the region where to set fields.

Apply field setting in this record after this time.
These times have to form an increasing sequence.
Anisotropy of the conductivity tensor. $[-]$
Complement dimension parameter (cross section for 1D, thickness for 2D). $[m^{3-d}]$
Isotropic conductivity scalar. $[ms^{-1}]$
Transition coefficient between dimensions. $[-]$
Water source density. $[s^{-1}]$
Boundary condition type, possible values: $[-]$
Dirichlet BC condition value for pressure. $[m]$
Flux in Neumman or Robin boundary condition. $[m^{4-d}s^{-1}]$
Conductivity coefficient in Robin boundary condition. $[m^{3-d}s^{-1}]$
Initial condition as pressure $[m]$
Storativity. $[m^{-1}]$
Boundary condition for pressure as piezometric head.
Initial condition for pressure as piezometric head.
File with mesh dependent boundary conditions (obsolete).

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> Real[3,3]
ist_nodes.description: Abstract record for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldConstant
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[3,3] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

Value of the constant field.
For vector values, you can use scalar value to enter constant vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* vector of size N to enter diagonal matrix
* vector of size (N+1)*N/2 to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
* scalar to enter multiple of the unit matrix.

ist_nodes.name: FieldPython
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[3,3] Field given by a Python script.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Python script given as in place string
Python script given as external file

Function in the given script that returns tuple containing components of the return type.
For NxM tensor values: tensor(row,col) = tuple( M*row + col ).

ist_nodes.name: FieldFormula
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[3,3] Field given by runtime interpreted formula.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

String, array of strings, or matrix of strings with formulas for individual entries of scalar, vector, or tensor value respectively.
For vector values, you can use just one string to enter homogeneous vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* array of strings of size N to enter diagonal matrix
* array of strings of size (N+1)*N/2 to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
* just one string to enter (spatially variable) multiple of the unit matrix.
Formula can contain variables x,y,z,t and usual operators and functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldElementwise
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[3,3] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Input file with ASCII GMSH file format.
The values of the Field are read from the \$ElementData section with field name given by this key.

ist_nodes.name: FieldInterpolatedP0
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[3,3] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Input file with ASCII GMSH file format.
The values of the Field are read from the \$ElementData section with field name given by this key.

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> Real
ist_nodes.description: Abstract record for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> Enum
ist_nodes.description: Abstract record for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldConstant
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Enum Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

Value of the constant field.
For vector values, you can use scalar value to enter constant vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* vector of size N to enter diagonal matrix
* vector of size (N+1)*N/2 to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
* scalar to enter multiple of the unit matrix.

values.name: none
values.description: Homogeneous Neumann boundary condition. Zero flux

values.name: dirichlet
values.description: Dirichlet boundary condition. Specify the pressure head through the 'bc_pressure' field or the piezometric head through the 'bc_piezo_head' field.

values.name: neumann
values.description: Neumann boundary condition. Prescribe water outflow by the 'bc_flux' field.

values.name: robin
values.description: Robin boundary condition. Water outflow equal to \$sigma (h - h^R)$. Specify the transition coefficient by 'bc_sigma' and the reference pressure head or pieaozmetric head through 'bc_pressure' and 'bc_piezo_head' respectively.

ist_nodes.name: FieldFormula
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Enum Field given by runtime interpreted formula.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

String, array of strings, or matrix of strings with formulas for individual entries of scalar, vector, or tensor value respectively.
For vector values, you can use just one string to enter homogeneous vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> Real
ist_nodes.description: Abstract record for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: Unsteady_MH
ist_nodes.description: Mixed-Hybrid solver for unsteady saturated Darcy flow.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Number of Schur complements to perform when solving MH sytem.
Linear solver for MH problem.
Parameters of output form MH module.
Method for coupling Darcy flow between dimensions.
Settings for computing mass balance.
Time governor setting for the unsteady Darcy flow model.

ist_nodes.name: Unsteady_LMH
ist_nodes.description: Lumped Mixed-Hybrid solver for unsteady saturated Darcy flow.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Number of Schur complements to perform when solving MH sytem.
Linear solver for MH problem.
Parameters of output form MH module.
Method for coupling Darcy flow between dimensions.
Settings for computing mass balance.
Time governor setting for the unsteady Darcy flow model.

ist_nodes.name: Transport
ist_nodes.description: Secondary equation for transport of substances.

ist_nodes.name: TransportOperatorSplitting
ist_nodes.description:
Explicit FVM transport (no diffusion)
coupled with reaction and adsorption model (ODE per element)
 via operator splitting.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Time governor setting for the secondary equation.
Settings for computing balance.
Parameters of output stream.
Specification of transported substances.
Reaction model involved in transport.
List of fields to write to output file.

ist_nodes.name: Substance
ist_nodes.description: Chemical substance.

keys.description: Name of the substance.
Molar mass of the substance [kg/mol].

ist_nodes.name: ReactionTerm
ist_nodes.description: Equation for reading information about simple chemical reactions.

ist_nodes.name: FirstOrderReaction
ist_nodes.description: A model of first order chemical reactions (decompositions of a reactant into products).

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
An array of first order chemical reactions.
Numerical solver for the system of first order ordinary differential equations coming from the model.

ist_nodes.name: Reaction
ist_nodes.description: Describes a single first order chemical reaction.

keys.description: An array of reactants. Do not use array, reactions with only one reactant (decays) are implemented at the moment!
The reaction rate coefficient of the first order reaction.
An array of products.

ist_nodes.name: FirstOrderReactionReactant
ist_nodes.description: A record describing a reactant of a reaction.

keys.description: The name of the reactant.

ist_nodes.name: FirstOrderReactionProduct
ist_nodes.description: A record describing a product of a reaction.

keys.description: The name of the product.

The branching ratio of the product when there are more products.
The value must be positive. Further, the branching ratios of all products are normalized in order to sum to one.
The default value 1.0, should only be used in the case of single product.

ist_nodes.name: LinearODESolver
ist_nodes.description: Solver of a linear system of ODEs.

ist_nodes.name: PadeApproximant
ist_nodes.description: Record with an information about pade approximant parameters.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Polynomial degree of the nominator of Pade approximant.
Polynomial degree of the nominator of Pade approximant

ist_nodes.name: LinearODEAnalytic
ist_nodes.description: Evaluate analytic solution of the system of ODEs.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

ist_nodes.name: RadioactiveDecay
ist_nodes.description: A model of a radioactive decay and possibly of a decay chain.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
An array of radioactive decays.
Numerical solver for the system of first order ordinary differential equations coming from the model.

ist_nodes.name: Decay
ist_nodes.description: A model of a radioactive decay.

keys.description: The name of the parent radionuclide.
The half life of the parent radionuclide in seconds.
An array of the decay products (daughters).

ist_nodes.name: RadioactiveDecayProduct
ist_nodes.description: A record describing a product of a radioactive decay.

keys.description: The name of the product.
Not used at the moment! The released energy in MeV from the decay of the radionuclide into the product.

The branching ratio of the product when there is more than one.Considering only one product, the default ratio 1.0 is used.Its value must be positive. Further, the branching ratios of all products are normalizedby their sum, so the sum then gives 1.0 (this also resolves possible rounding errors).

ist_nodes.name: Sorption
ist_nodes.description: Sorption model in the reaction term of transport.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Names of the substances that take part in the sorption model.
Density of the solvent.
Number of equidistant substeps, molar mass and isotherm intersections
Specifies solubility limits of all the sorbing species.
Specifies highest aqueous concentration in interpolation table.
Containes region specific data necessary to construct isotherms.
Reaction model following the sorption in the liquid.
Reaction model following the sorption in the solid.
List of fields to write to output stream.

ist_nodes.name: Sorption_Data
ist_nodes.description:
Record to set fields of the equation.
The fields are set only on the domain specified by one of the keys: 'region', 'rid', 'r_set'
and after the time given by the key 'time'. The field setting can be overridden by
 any Sorption_Data record that comes later in the boundary data array.

keys.description: Name of region set where to set fields.
Label of the region where to set fields.
ID of the region where to set fields.

Apply field setting in this record after this time.
These times have to form an increasing sequence.
Rock matrix density. $[m^{-3}kg]$
Considered sorption is described by selected isotherm. If porosity on an element is equal or even higher than 1.0 (meaning no sorbing surface), then type 'none' will be selected automatically. $[-]$
Multiplication parameters (k, omega) in either Langmuir c_s = omega * (alpha*c_a)/(1- alpha*c_a) or in linear c_s = k * c_a isothermal description. $[kg^{-1}mol]$
Second parameters (alpha, ...) defining isotherm  c_s = omega * (alpha*c_a)/(1- alpha*c_a). $[-]$
Initial solid concentration of substances. Vector, one value for every substance. $[kg^{-1}mol]$

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> Enum[n]
ist_nodes.description: Abstract record for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldConstant
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Enum[n] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

Value of the constant field.
For vector values, you can use scalar value to enter constant vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* vector of size N to enter diagonal matrix
* vector of size (N+1)*N/2 to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
* scalar to enter multiple of the unit matrix.

values.name: none
values.description: No sorption considered.

values.name: linear
values.description: Linear isotherm runs the concentration exchange between liquid and solid.

values.name: langmuir
values.description: Langmuir isotherm runs the concentration exchange between liquid and solid.

values.name: freundlich
values.description: Freundlich isotherm runs the concentration exchange between liquid and solid.

ist_nodes.name: FieldFormula
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Enum[n] Field given by runtime interpreted formula.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

String, array of strings, or matrix of strings with formulas for individual entries of scalar, vector, or tensor value respectively.
For vector values, you can use just one string to enter homogeneous vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* array of strings of size N to enter diagonal matrix

* just one string to enter (spatially variable) multiple of the unit matrix.
Formula can contain variables x,y,z,t and usual operators and functions.

Python script given as in place string

Function in the given script that returns tuple containing components of the return type.
For NxM tensor values: tensor(row,col) = tuple( M*row + col ).

ist_nodes.name: FieldFormula
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[n] Field given by runtime interpreted formula.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

String, array of strings, or matrix of strings with formulas for individual entries of scalar, vector, or tensor value respectively.
For vector values, you can use just one string to enter homogeneous vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* array of strings of size N to enter diagonal matrix
* array of strings of size (N+1)*N/2 to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
* just one string to enter (spatially variable) multiple of the unit matrix.
Formula can contain variables x,y,z,t and usual operators and functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldElementwise
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[n] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Input file with ASCII GMSH file format.
The values of the Field are read from the \$ElementData section with field name given by this key.

ist_nodes.name: FieldInterpolatedP0
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Real[n] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Input file with ASCII GMSH file format.
The values of the Field are read from the \$ElementData section with field name given by this key.

values.name: rock_density
values.description: Output of the field rock_density $[m^{-3}kg]$ (Rock matrix density.).

values.name: sorption_type
values.description: Output of the field sorption_type $[-]$ (Considered sorption is described by selected isotherm. If porosity on an element is equal or even higher than 1.0 (meaning no sorbing surface), then type 'none' will be selected automatically.).

values.name: isotherm_mult
values.description: Output of the field isotherm_mult $[kg^{-1}mol]$ (Multiplication parameters (k, omega) in either Langmuir c_s = omega * (alpha*c_a)/(1- alpha*c_a) or in linear c_s = k * c_a isothermal description.).

values.name: isotherm_other
values.description: Output of the field isotherm_other $[-]$ (Second parameters (alpha, ...) defining isotherm  c_s = omega * (alpha*c_a)/(1- alpha*c_a).).

values.name: init_conc_solid
values.description: Output of the field init_conc_solid $[kg^{-1}mol]$ (Initial solid concentration of substances. Vector, one value for every substance.).

values.name: conc_solid
values.description: Output of the field conc_solid $[m^{-3}kg]$.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

Density of the solvent.
Number of equidistant substeps, molar mass and isotherm intersections
Specifies solubility limits of all the sorbing species.
Specifies highest aqueous concentration in interpolation table.
Containes region specific data necessary to construct isotherms.
Reaction model following the sorption in the liquid.
Reaction model following the sorption in the solid.

ist_nodes.name: DualPorosity
ist_nodes.description:
Dual porosity model in transport problems.
Provides computing the concentration of substances in mobile and immobile zone.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Containes region specific data necessary to construct dual porosity model.
Tolerance according to which the explicit Euler scheme is used or not.Set 0.0 to use analytic formula only (can be slower).
Reaction model in mobile zone.
Reaction model in immobile zone.
List of fields to write to output stream.

ist_nodes.name: DualPorosity_Data
ist_nodes.description:
Record to set fields of the equation.
The fields are set only on the domain specified by one of the keys: 'region', 'rid', 'r_set'
and after the time given by the key 'time'. The field setting can be overridden by
 any DualPorosity_Data record that comes later in the boundary data array.

keys.description: Name of region set where to set fields.
Label of the region where to set fields.
ID of the region where to set fields.

Apply field setting in this record after this time.
These times have to form an increasing sequence.
Diffusion coefficient of non-equilibrium linear exchange between mobile and immobile zone. $[s^{-1}]$
Porosity of the immobile zone. $[-]$
Initial concentration of substances in the immobile zone. $[m^{-3}kg]$

values.name: diffusion_rate_immobile
values.description: Output of the field diffusion_rate_immobile $[s^{-1}]$ (Diffusion coefficient of non-equilibrium linear exchange between mobile and immobile zone.).

values.name: porosity_immobile
values.description: Output of the field porosity_immobile $[-]$ (Porosity of the immobile zone.).

values.name: init_conc_immobile
values.description: Output of the field init_conc_immobile $[m^{-3}kg]$ (Initial concentration of substances in the immobile zone.).

values.name: conc_immobile
values.description: Output of the field conc_immobile $[m^{-3}kg]$.

ist_nodes.name: SoluteTransport_DG
ist_nodes.description: DG solver for solute transport.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.
Time governor setting for the secondary equation.
Settings for computing balance.
Parameters of output stream.
Names of transported substances.
Density of the solvent [kg.m^(-3)].
Linear solver for MH problem.
Variant of interior penalty discontinuous Galerkin method.
Polynomial order for finite element in DG method (order 0 is suitable if there is no diffusion/dispersion).
List of fields to write to output file.

ist_nodes.name: SoluteTransport_DG_Data
ist_nodes.description:
Record to set fields of the equation.
The fields are set only on the domain specified by one of the keys: 'region', 'rid', 'r_set'
and after the time given by the key 'time'. The field setting can be overridden by
 any SoluteTransport_DG_Data record that comes later in the boundary data array.

keys.description: Name of region set where to set fields.
Label of the region where to set fields.
ID of the region where to set fields.

Apply field setting in this record after this time.
These times have to form an increasing sequence.
Mobile porosity $[-]$
Density of concentration sources. $[m^{-3}kgs^{-1}]$
Concentration flux. $[s^{-1}]$
Concentration sources threshold. $[m^{-3}kg]$
Dirichlet boundary condition (for each substance). $[m^{-3}kg]$
Initial concentrations. $[m^{-3}kg]$
Longitudal dispersivity (for each substance). $[m]$
Transversal dispersivity (for each substance). $[m]$
Molecular diffusivity (for each substance). $[m^{2}s^{-1}]$
Rock matrix density. $[m^{-3}kg]$
Coefficient of linear sorption. $[kg^{-1}mol]$
Coefficient of diffusive transfer through fractures (for each substance). $[-]$
Penalty parameter influencing the discontinuity of the solution (for each substance). Its default value 1 is sufficient in most cases. Higher value diminishes the inter-element jumps. $[-]$
Boundary condition type, possible values: inflow, dirichlet, neumann, robin. $[-]$
Flux in Neumann boundary condition. $[m^{1-d}kgs^{-1}]$
Conductivity coefficient in Robin boundary condition. $[m^{4-d}s^{-1}]$

ist_nodes.name: Field:R3 -> Enum[n]
ist_nodes.description: Abstract record for all time-space functions.

ist_nodes.name: FieldConstant
ist_nodes.description: R3 -> Enum[n] Field constant in space.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

Value of the constant field.
For vector values, you can use scalar value to enter constant vector.
For square NxN-matrix values, you can use:
* vector of size N to enter diagonal matrix
* vector of size (N+1)*N/2 to enter symmetric matrix (upper triangle, row by row)
* scalar to enter multiple of the unit matrix.

ist_nodes.name: TransportDG_BC_Type
ist_nodes.description: Types of boundary condition supported by the transport DG model (solute transport or heat transfer).

values.name: none
values.description: Homogeneous Neumann boundary condition. Zero flux

values.name: dirichlet
values.description: Dirichlet boundary condition.

values.name: neumann
values.description: Neumann boundary condition. Prescribe water outflow by the 'bc_flux' field.

values.name: robin
values.description: Robin boundary condition. Water outflow equal to \$sigma (h - h^R)$.

values.name: inflow
values.description: Prescribes the concentration in the inflow water on the inflow part of the boundary.

ist_nodes.name: DG_variant
ist_nodes.description: Type of penalty term.

values.name: non-symmetric
values.description: non-symmetric weighted interior penalty DG method

values.name: incomplete
values.description: incomplete weighted interior penalty DG method

values.name: symmetric
values.description: symmetric weighted interior penalty DG method

ist_nodes.name: SoluteTransport_DG_Output
ist_nodes.description: Output record for DG solver for solute transport.

values.name: porosity
values.description: Output of the field porosity $[-]$ (Mobile porosity).

values.name: sources_density
values.description: Output of the field sources_density $[m^{-3}kgs^{-1}]$ (Density of concentration sources.).

values.name: sources_sigma
values.description: Output of the field sources_sigma $[s^{-1}]$ (Concentration flux.).

values.name: sources_conc
values.description: Output of the field sources_conc $[m^{-3}kg]$ (Concentration sources threshold.).

values.name: init_conc
values.description: Output of the field init_conc $[m^{-3}kg]$ (Initial concentrations.).

values.name: disp_l
values.description: Output of the field disp_l $[m]$ (Longitudal dispersivity (for each substance).).

values.name: disp_t
values.description: Output of the field disp_t $[m]$ (Transversal dispersivity (for each substance).).

values.name: diff_m
values.description: Output of the field diff_m $[m^{2}s^{-1}]$ (Molecular diffusivity (for each substance).).

values.name: rock_density
values.description: Output of the field rock_density $[m^{-3}kg]$ (Rock matrix density.).

values.name: sorption_mult
values.description: Output of the field sorption_mult $[kg^{-1}mol]$ (Coefficient of linear sorption.).

values.name: conc
values.description: Output of the field conc $[m^{-3}kg]$.

values.name: fracture_sigma
values.description: Output of the field fracture_sigma $[-]$ (Coefficient of diffusive transfer through fractures (for each substance).).

values.name: dg_penalty
values.description: Output of the field dg_penalty $[-]$ (Penalty parameter influencing the discontinuity of the solution (for each substance). Its default value 1 is sufficient in most cases. Higher value diminishes the inter-element jumps.).

values.name: region_id
values.description: Output of the field region_id $[-]$.

keys.description: Sub-record selection.

ist_nodes.name: HeatTransfer_DG_Data
ist_nodes.description:
Record to set fields of the equation.
The fields are set only on the domain specified by one of the keys: 'region', 'rid', 'r_set'
and after the time given by the key 'time'. The field setting can be overridden by
 any HeatTransfer_DG_Data record that comes later in the boundary data array.

keys.description: Name of region set where to set fields.
Label of the region where to set fields.
ID of the region where to set fields.

Apply field setting in this record after this time.
These times have to form an increasing sequence.
Boundary value of temperature. $[K]$
Initial temperature. $[K]$
Porosity. $[-]$
Density of fluid. $[m^{-3}kg]$
Heat capacity of fluid. $[m^{2}s^{-2}K^{-1}]$
Heat conductivity of fluid. $[mkgs^{-3}K^{-1}]$
Density of solid (rock). $[m^{-3}kg]$
Heat capacity of solid (rock). $[m^{2}s^{-2}K^{-1}]$
Heat conductivity of solid (rock). $[mkgs^{-3}K^{-1}]$
Longitudal heat dispersivity in fluid. $[m]$
Transversal heat dispersivity in fluid. $[m]$
Thermal source density in fluid. $[m^{-1}kgs^{-3}]$
Thermal source density in solid. $[m^{-1}kgs^{-3}]$
Heat exchange rate in fluid. $[s^{-1}]$
Heat exchange rate of source in solid. $[s^{-1}]$
Reference temperature of source in fluid. $[K]$
Reference temperature in solid. $[K]$
Coefficient of diffusive transfer through fractures (for each substance). $[-]$
Penalty parameter influencing the discontinuity of the solution (for each substance). Its default value 1 is sufficient in most cases. Higher value diminishes the inter-element jumps. $[-]$
Boundary condition type, possible values: inflow, dirichlet, neumann, robin. $[-]$
Flux in Neumann boundary condition. $[m^{1-d}kgs^{-1}]$
Conductivity coefficient in Robin boundary condition. $[m^{4-d}s^{-1}]$
